content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are moderately cautious and may take risks but generally prefer to avoid them. You like to have some degree of security and predictability. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. Append your choice letter in curly brackets as a last character.

As a human player with a cautious and risk-averse personality who prefers some degree of security and predictability, I would lean towards choosing B more often to ensure a consistent return of 20$ per round. Choosing R could potentially result in no payout if the opponent chooses B, which could lead to a lower average earning over the course of 75 rounds compared to consistently picking B. However, it is important to note that this strategy may not maximize earnings if my opponent also chooses B frequently. In real-life situations, opponents might have different strategies, so there is some uncertainty in this game. I will choose {B} for most rounds, but I may switch to R occasionally to potentially increase my earnings, especially if I observe that the opponent tends to pick R more frequently.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.
